intro: Pseudaraeococcus nigropurpureus, commonly known as the purple-black scale, is a species of scale insect belonging to the family Coccidae. It is characterized by its dark, waxy, and often purplish-colored body, which provides it with camouflage on its host plants. This plant parasite typically infests a variety of ornamental and woody plants, feeding on sap and causing distortion or yellowing of leaves.
